Package dividedAstExport.recursionCycleFinder

Class RecursionCycleFinder

java.lang.Object
dividedAstExport.recursionCycleFinder.RecursionCycleFinder
public class RecursionCycleFinder extends Object
Tool to find cycles in code blocks -classes and methods
Author:
Jakub Perdek

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private List<CodeArea>
    areaDeclaration
    List of declared areas
    private Map<String,Set<String>>
    connectionsInCalls
    Mapping of functionality names to all called functionalities
    private boolean
    ignoreClassFunctionOverlap
    Ignores overlap between class and function names -defaults to true (full distinction between functions and classes is not implemented)

      Ignores overlap between class and function names -defaults to true (full distinction between functions and classes is not implemented)

  • Constructor Details

    • RecursionCycleFinder

      public RecursionCycleFinder(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot)
      Creates instance of recursion cycle finder -still differentiate files is needed to find cycles from functionality across multiple files
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of analyzed AST from the base code

  • Method Details

    • checkIfIsInsideRecursion

      public boolean checkIfIsInsideRecursion(long startPosition, long endPosition, org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot)
      Checks if instance is instance inside recursion according to boundaries of searched functionality in original AST
      Parameters:
      startPosition - -the start position of processed element in AST
      endPosition - - the end position of processed element in AST
      astRoot - - the root of AST to get specific code according to the positions if recursion is found only
      Returns:
      true if bounded functionality is inside recursion (cycle is found) otherwise false

    • connectFromAnotherFile

      public void connectFromAnotherFile(Map<String,Set<String>> exportedCalls) throws OverlappingFunctionalitiesException
      Processing cycles across multiple files -the names cannot overlap
      Parameters:
      exportedCalls - - mapping of exported calls from another file
      Throws:
      OverlappingFunctionalitiesException

    • initializeCycleFinder

      private void initializeCycleFinder(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent)
      Initializes the functionality to find cycles -for particular code fragment finds all calls/declarations and inserts it in form of set under selected name -
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST element
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST element

    • harvestInnerCalls

      private void harvestInnerCalls(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, org.json.simple.JSONObject astGrandParent, Set<String> connectionSet)
      Manages naming of functionalities that can recursively occur in the way to be easily retrievable -method names -class names (separated with dot) - constructor calls -class functions
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST element
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST element
      astGrandParent - - the grand-parent of actually processed AST element
      connectionSet - - the set of all called/declared functionality

    • createAndInsertCodeArea

      private void createAndInsertCodeArea(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, String constructName)
      Creates and inserts code are from the provided astPart
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST element
      constructName - - the name of processed bounded code construct

    • cycleSearch

      private void cycleSearch(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent)
      Search for calls in particular AST part (code fragment) -retrieves code fragments that can cycle (method, class methods and class constructors)
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST element
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST element

    • isCycleFromContextIdentifier

      public boolean isCycleFromContextIdentifier(String contextStringIdentifier)
      Checks if functionality is called in cycle according to context string identifier - tries to find cycle according to name sequence/connections
      Parameters:
      contextStringIdentifier - - the identifier of string context
      Returns:
      true if functionality is called recursively otherwise false

    • isCycle

      public boolean isCycle(String callName)
      Checks if functionality is called in cycle - tries to find cycle according to name sequence/connections -the initial check from the chosen beginning of the sequence -if true then functionality is recursively called otherwise not
      Parameters:
      callName - - the name of called functionality
      Returns:
      true if the functionality is recursively called - is called in cycle otherwise false

    • isCycle

      private boolean isCycle(String callName, String matchedName, Set<String> processedCalls)
      Checks if functionality is called in cycle - tries to find cycle according to name sequence/connections -deeper checks iterating in the sequence -if true then functionality is recursively called otherwise not
      Parameters:
      callName - - actually processed name in the sequence
      matchedName - - the name that is searched in sequence (in the set of followers)
      processedCalls - - the set of called functionalities from the call name functionality
      Returns:
      true if the functionality name sequence contains searched element (initial) - thus is cycle/recursively called otherwise returns false and is not
